title: Ciara enjoys an evening out at Catch restaurant in LA
text:
She never fails to turn heads with her sensational sense of style.

And Ciara looked radiant as ever as she enjoyed an evening at Catch restaurant in Los Angeles on Monday.

The singer, 33, cut a stylish figure for her night on the town, donning a burgundy long-sleeved knee-length dress.

Stunning: Ciara, 33, looked radiant as ever as she enjoyed an evening at Catch restaurant in Los Angeles on Monday

Also sporting black boots, Ciara let her raven locks fall loose down her shoulders while she added to her outfit with several silver necklaces.

Ciara was joined by a female friend for her evening out and the pair wrapped their arms around each other as they made their way inside the restaurant.

Ciara's musical career started in 2003 shortly after she graduated high school and was signed to LaFace records.

The singer recently marked the fifteenth anniversary of her debut single Goodies which spent seven weeks at number one on the Billboard Hot 100.

Fashion: The singer cut a stylish figure for her night on the town, donning a burgundy long-sleeved knee-length dress

Pals: Ciara was joined by a female friend for her evening out and the pair wrapped their arms around each other as they made their way inside the restaurant

Ciara told Billboard in an interview celebrating the track's anniversary: 'I can’t even believe it’s 15 years ago, it’s blowing my mind.'

The singer was just 18 years old when Goodies debuted and topped the Billboard charts. Ciara made history as the first woman to take on the Crunk N' B genre founded by Lil Jon.

'I graduated when I was 17 years old and I was on camera going, "I see myself having a No. 1 song on the Billboard chart and da da da," and I was declaring what I foresaw happening or what I believed could happen.

Style: Also sporting black boots, Ciara let her raven locks fall loose down her shoulders while she added to her outfit with several silver necklaces

'What Lil Jon did was historic for music, because he came in with the fresh sound and he went against the grain of what traditional pop was at that time period,' she explained to the outlet.

'And I was the first girl to do it. So I was really proud of that and will forever be proud of it.'

She recalled the first time she heard the song on the radio in an Atlanta fast food restaurant, which is what she calls the second 'my dream came true in every way I could have imagined and more.'

Ciara has been married to Russell Wilson since 2016, and together they share two-year-old Sienna. She also shares five-year-old Future with rapper ex Future.
